title: Steak with Green Peppercorns Timber Club
ingredients: Four 10-ounce sirloin steaks, sprinkled with salt
½ stick (¼ cup) plus 3 tablespoons butter
3 tablespoons brown stock or beef broth
instructions: In a skillet sauté four 10-ounce sirloin steaks, sprinkled with salt, in ½ stick of butter over high heat for 2 minutes on each side for rare meat.  Pour in the Cognac, heated, and ignite it.  Transfer the steaks to a heated platter and keep them warm.

In the pan sauté 2 tablespoons of minced shallot for 2 minutes, stir in the red wine and reduce the liquid over high heat by half.  Stir in the heavy cream, 3 tablespoons of brown stock (or beef broth), 2 tablespoons softened butter, the Dijon-style mustard, a dash of Madeira, and salt and pepper to taste and keep the sauce warm.
In a separate small skillet sauté the drained green peppercorns in one tablespoon of butter for 1 minute.
Pour the sauce of the steaks and then pour the green peppercorns over the sauce to serve.
Remarks:  For one large, or two small sirloin steaks, cut the ingredients in half and follow the same instruction.
Source:  Gourmet Holidays:  Vancouver by Veronica Thomas, Gourmet Magazine, September 1975.
